text:
Jeremy Corbyn's Leicestershire supporters rallying round leader as bid to topple him is launched By danjmartin | Posted: July 11, 2016 0 COMMENTS SHARES Jeremy Corbyn's Leicestershire supporters rallying round leader as bid to toppl... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
Supporters of Jeremy Corbyn in Leicestershire are rallying round their leader after a bid to oust him was officially launched. 
Angela Eagle has declared she will challenge Mr Corbyn for the leadership. 
The former shadow business secretary said she had no choice but to move against Mr Corbyn because Britain was in danger of becoming a "one-party Tory state" under his leadership. 
Her bid looks set to trigger civil war within the party and comes after 172 Labour MPs said that they had no confidence in Mr Corbyn in a vote in which he garnered the support of just 40 Westminster colleagues. 
However Mr Corbyn's backers are confident will be keep his position on the back of popular support he has among Labour's membership who will vote to decide matter. 
Read more: Andrew Bridgen fears 'diluted' Brexit after Leadsom quits Tory leadership race 
A spokesman for the Harborough Constituency Labour Party (CLP) said its membership had swelled recently from 160 to 460 with new recruits supporting Mr Corbyn.The Harborough CLP voted by 45 to 12 to pass a motion backing the leader by reaffirming 'the mandate given by the membership to the elected leader of the Labour Party." 
The motion added: "We condemn attempts by members of the Parliamentary Labour Party to undermine the leadership by subverting the democratic process of the party. 
"We call on all Labour Party members to abide by our democratic process and unite in order to resolve this crisis with all possible speed, so that we can continue to fight for the people of Britain at this time of political, economic and social crisis." 
A similar motion has been proposed for debate by the South Leicestershire CLP on July 19. 
Read more: Council staff had to watch hundreds of hours of explicit CCTV for lap dancing club case, court hears 
The Mercury has also been passed an email circulated by Labour Leicester city councillor Patrick Kitterick urging his 51 colleagues to sign a letter acknowledging Mr Corbyn's 'overwhelming democratic mandate'. 
Coun Kitterick's email said the letter would be sent to the Mercury on Friday but so far it has not arrived. 
One Labour source said: "He won't send it because he'll be lucky to get five or six names out of 50-odd'. 
Coun Kitterick would not say how many councillors had signed it but said: "There were a couple of negative responses and that was to be expected. 
"Some said they wouldn't sign anything either way but some will sign."I don't accept this idea that Labour is unelectable under Jeremy Corbyn." 
He pointed to Labour's recent victory, under Mr Corbyn's leadership, in the Leicestershire police and crime commissioner election.
